A subtype of OPC UA Structure that defines three linked data items: the ID, which is a unique identifier for a property, the value, which is the data that is identified, and an optional description of the parameter.
Defines a personnel resource or a person, a quantity, an optional description, and an optional collection of properties.

A subtype of OPC UA Structure that defines two linked data items: an ID, which is a unique identifier for a property within the scope of the associated resource, and the value, which is the data for the property.
Defines an equipment resource or a piece of equipment, a quantity, an optional description, and an optional collection of properties.
Defines a physical asset, a quantity, an optional description, and an optional collection of properties.
Defines a material resource, a quantity, an optional description, and an optional collection of properties.

contents.name: Closed
contents.description: The job order has been completed and no further post processing is performed.

contents.name: Completed
contents.description: The job order has been completed and is no longer in execution.

contents.name: FromCompletedToClosed
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the system has finalized post processing of a ended job order.

contents.name: FromHeldToSuspended
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the system has switched the job order from internally held to externally suspended, for example by a call of the Pause Method.

contents.name: FromSuspendedToHeld
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the system has switched the job order from externally suspended to an internal held, for example by a call of the Resume Method.

contents.name: Held
contents.description: The job order has been temporarily stopped due to a constraint of some form.

contents.name: Suspended
contents.description: The job order has been temporarily stopped due to a deliberate decision within the execution system.

description: The OPENSCSJobOrderReciverObjectType contains a method to receive job order commands and optional definitions of allowable job order information

schemas.description: Defines the information needed to schedule and execute a job.
Defines a Work Master ID and the defined parameters for the Work Master.

A subtype of OPC UA Structure that defines three linked data items: the ID, which is a unique identifier for a property, the value, which is the data that is identified, and an optional description of the parameter.
Defines the information needed to schedule and execute a job.
Defines a personnel resource or a person, a quantity, an optional description, and an optional collection of properties.
Defines an equipment resource or a piece of equipment, a quantity, an optional description, and an optional collection of properties.

A subtype of OPC UA Structure that defines two linked data items: an ID, which is a unique identifier for a property within the scope of the associated resource, and the value, which is the data for the property.
Defines the information needed to schedule and execute a job.
Defines a physical asset, a quantity, an optional description, and an optional collection of properties.
Defines a material resource, a quantity, an optional description, and an optional collection of properties.

contents.name: EquipmentID
contents.description: Defines a read-only set of Equipment Class IDs and Equipment IDs that may be specified in a job order.

contents.name: JobOrderList
contents.description: Defines a read-only list of job order information available from the server.

contents.name: MaterialClassID
contents.description: Defines a read-only set of Material Classes IDs that may be specified in a job order.

contents.name: MaterialDefinitionID
contents.description: Defines a read-only set of Material Classes IDs that may be specified in a job order.

contents.name: PersonnelID
contents.description: Defines a read-only set of Personnel IDs and Person IDs that may be specified in a job order.

contents.name: PhysicalAssetID
contents.description: Defines a read-only set of Physical Asset Class IDs and Physical Asset IDs that may be specified in a job order.

contents.name: WorkMaster
contents.description: Defines a read-only set of work master IDs that may be specified in a job order, and the read-only set of parameters that may be specified for a specific work master.

contents.name: Aborted
contents.description: The job order is aborted.

contents.name: AllowedToStart
contents.description: The job order is stored and may be executed.

contents.name: Ended
contents.description: The job order has been completed and is no longer in execution.

contents.name: FromAllowedToStartToAborted
contents.description: This transition is triggered when Abort Method is called.

contents.name: FromAllowedToStartToAllowedToStart
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the Update Method is called and the job order is modified.

contents.name: FromAllowedToStartToNotAllowedToStart
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the RevokeStart Method is called.

contents.name: FromAllowedToStartToRunning
contents.description: This transition is triggered when a job order is started to be executed.

contents.name: FromInterruptedToAborted
contents.description: This transition is triggered when Abort Method is called.

contents.name: FromInterruptedToEnded
contents.description: This transition is triggered when Stop Method is called.

contents.name: FromInterruptedToRunning
contents.description: This transition is triggered when Resume Method is called.

contents.name: FromNotAllowedToStartToAborted
contents.description: This transition is triggered when Abort Method is called.

contents.name: FromNotAllowedToStartToAllowedToStart
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the Start Method is called.

contents.name: FromNotAllowedToStartToNotAllowedToStart
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the Update Method is called and the job order is modified.

contents.name: FromRunningToAborted
contents.description: This transition is triggered when Abort Method is called.

contents.name: FromRunningToEnded
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the execution of a job order has finished, either internally or by the Stop Method.

contents.name: FromRunningToInterrupted
contents.description: This transition is triggered when an executing job order gets interrupted, either internally or by the Pause Method.

contents.name: Interrupted
contents.description: The job order has been temporarily stopped.

contents.name: NotAllowedToStart
contents.description: The job order is stored but may not be executed.

contents.name: Running
contents.description: The job order is executing.

contents.name: AllowedToStartSubstates
contents.description: Substates of AllowedToStart

contents.name: EndedSubstates
contents.description: Substates of Ended

contents.name: InterruptedSubstates
contents.description: Substates of Interrupted

contents.name: NotAllowedToStartSubstates
contents.description: Substates of NotAllowedToStart

contents.name: FromLoadedToReady
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the program or configuration to execute the job order is unloaded.

contents.name: FromLoadedToWaiting
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the system is not ready to start the execution of the job order anymore.

contents.name: FromReadyToLoaded
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the program or configuration to execute the job order is loaded.

contents.name: FromReadyToWaiting
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the system is not ready to start the execution of the job order anymore.

contents.name: FromWaitingToReady
contents.description: This transition is triggered when the system is ready to start the execution of the job order.

contents.name: Loaded
contents.description: In situations where only one job may be in active memory and is able to be run, then the job is loaded in active memory, the necessary pre-conditions have been met, and the job order is ready to run, awaiting a Start command.

contents.name: Ready
contents.description: The necessary pre-conditions have been met and the job order is ready to run, awaiting a Start command.

contents.name: Waiting
contents.description: The necessary pre-conditions have not been met and the job order is not ready to run.
